channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for OR
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for OR

item.title: Report X-2024031439
item.description:
Report X-2024031439

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-01T03:13:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-28
  • City: PORTLAND
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDED TO A LEAKING AIR PACKAGE. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED THREE X 20 OUNCE AEROSOL CANS OF FAULTLESS HEAVY FINISH SPRAY STARCH WITH ONE LEAKING FROM THE CLOSURE. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THERMAL LABEL DESCRIPTION IS FAULTLESS HEAVY SPRAY STARCH 20 OZ CANS (3 PACK). THERE IS NO SHIPPER PICK UP SCAN. THE PACKAGE ENTERED THE NETWORK IN SACRAMENTO, CA. THIS PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM CALIFORNIA USING NONEXISTENT UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER F104E1. THIS ACCOUNT NUMBER IS NOT ASSOCIATED TO A VALID UPS ACCOUNT HOLDER. TRACKING LABEL SHIPPER: CA WAREHOUSE, 1(662)528-6448, 1250 HARBOUR BLVD STE 400, WEST SACRAMENTO CA 95691. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

  • Description: RESPONDED TO A LEAKING AIR PACKAGE. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED TWO X 20 OUNCE AEROSOL CANS OF FAULTLESS HEAVY FINISH SPRAY STARCH WITH ONE LEAKING FROM THE CLOSURE. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THERMAL LABEL SHIPPER DESCRIPTION IS LAUNDRY STARCH SPRAY, FAULTLESS HEAVY SPRAY STARCH 20 OZ CANS FOR A SMOOTH IRON GLIDE ON CLOTHES FABRIC EVEN SPRAY. EASY IRON GLIDE. NO RESIDUE (PACK OF 2). THERE IS NO SHIPPER PICK UP SCAN. THE PACKAGE ENTERED THE NETWORK IN SACRAMENTO, CA. THIS PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM CALIFORNIA USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER 8293W9, MOYNAT, 611 5TH AVE, NEW YORK NY 10022-6813. TRACKING LABEL SHIPPER: CA WAREHOUSE, 1(662)528-6448, 1250 HARBOUR BLVD STE 400, WEST SACRAMENTO CA 95691. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

item.title: Report E-2024030585
item.description:
Report E-2024030585

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-01T03:13:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-20
  • City: PORTLAND
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On March 20, 2024, one (1) 300-gallon tote of sodium hydroxide leaked due to long term use and released approximately less than one (<1) gallon of product to the trailer interior and pavement beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from GrayMar Environmental Services (GES) to remediate the impacted site. GES decontaminated the impacted surfaces of the totes and trailer floor with neutralizing solution and absorbent pads. GES collected all spent absorbents and containerized them into one (1) 5-gallon pail for further handling by CES. The damaged tote was left on site for a scheduled straight time, new tote-transfer as requested by the shipper.

item.title: Report X-2024031035
item.description:
Report X-2024031035

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-27T15:12:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-19
  • City: PORTLAND
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: TWILIGHT RESPONDER RESPONDED TO A HAZMAT THAT HAD A STAIN THAT WAS SHOWING. THE RESPONDER PUT ON THE PROPER PPE AND USED HIS DECISION TREE TO BRING THE PACKAGE BACK TO THE PSC TO PROCESS. TWILIGHT RESPONDER DID A LEAK TEST ON THE CONTAINER, NOTICED THAT IT WAS NO LONGER LEAKING AND PUT LIQUID IN CONTAINER INTO GREEN DMP BAG, AND ALSO MADE A SEPERATE DMP BAG FOR THE AFFECTED CARDBOARD.
